features.featureDescription: Service supports disabling public network access either through using service-level IP ACL filtering rule (not NSG or Azure Firewall) or using a 'Disable Public Network Access' toggle switch.
features.featureGuidance: Disable public network access using the Azure Key Vault firewall IP filtering rules.
features.customerActionsDescription: Secure cloud native services with network controls

features.featureDescription: Service native IP filtering capability for filtering network traffic (not to be confused with NSG or Azure Firewall).
features.featureGuidance: Deploy private endpoints for Azure Key Vault to establish a private access point for the resources.
features.customerActionsDescription: Secure cloud native services with network controls

automatedPolicyAvailability.policyName: Azure Key Vault should have firewall enabled
automatedPolicyAvailability.policyDescription: Enable the key vault firewall so that the key vault is not accessible by default to any public IPs. Optionally, you can configure specific IP ranges to limit access to those networks. Learn more at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/key-vault/general/network-security

automatedPolicyAvailability.policyName: Azure Key Vaults should use private link
automatedPolicyAvailability.policyDescription: Azure Private Link lets you connect your virtual networks to Azure services without a public IP address at the source or destination. The Private Link platform handles the connectivity between the consumer and services over the Azure backbone network. By mapping private endpoints to key vault, you can reduce data leakage risks. Learn more about private links at: https://aka.ms/akvprivatelink.
